info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 12:29PM CDT until April 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Red River At Coushatta affecting Bienville, Bossier, Caddo, Red River and Natchitoches Parishes.
For the Red River...including Coushatta...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red River at Coushatta.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs. Minor backwater flooding occurs from the confluence or the Red River with Loggy Bayou as well as up through the lower Flat River and lower Red Chute Bayou in southern Bossier Parish. Livestock and equipment should be moved to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 26.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 31.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.0 feet on 12/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Bienville, LA; Bossier, LA; Caddo, LA; Natchitoches, LA; Red River, LA
